trans-unit.source: Smooth Streaming Windows Store App Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Smooth Streaming Windows Store App Tutorial

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Media Services to create a C# Windows Store application with a XML MediaElement control to playback Smooth Stream content.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Media Services to create a C# Windows Store application with a XML MediaElement control to playback Smooth Stream content.

trans-unit.source: How to Build a Smooth Streaming Windows Store Application
trans-unit.target: How to Build a Smooth Streaming Windows Store Application

trans-unit.source: The Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8 enables developers to build Windows Store applications that can play on-demand and live Smooth Streaming content.
trans-unit.target: The Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8 enables developers to build Windows Store applications that can play on-demand and live Smooth Streaming content.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the basic playback of Smooth Streaming content, the SDK also provides rich features like Microsoft PlayReady protection, quality level restriction, Live DVR, audio stream switching, listening for status updates (such as quality level changes) and error events, and so on.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the basic playback of Smooth Streaming content, the SDK also provides rich features like Microsoft PlayReady protection, quality level restriction, Live DVR, audio stream switching, listening for status updates (such as quality level changes) and error events, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For more information of the supported features, see the [release notes](http://www.iis.net/learn/media/smooth-streaming/smooth-streaming-client-sdk-for-windows-8-release-notes).
trans-unit.target: For more information of the supported features, see the [release notes](http://www.iis.net/learn/media/smooth-streaming/smooth-streaming-client-sdk-for-windows-8-release-notes).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers the APIs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers the APIs.

trans-unit.source: For player development, Microsoft strongly recommends using [Player Framework for Windows 8](http://playerframework.codeplex.com/).
trans-unit.target: For player development, Microsoft strongly recommends using [Player Framework for Windows 8](http://playerframework.codeplex.com/).

trans-unit.source: Player framework makes it easier to build applications and provides many additional features.
trans-unit.target: Player framework makes it easier to build applications and provides many additional features.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial contains four lessons:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial contains four lessons:

trans-unit.source: Create a Basic Smooth Streaming Store Application
trans-unit.target: Create a Basic Smooth Streaming Store Application

trans-unit.source: Add a Slider Bar to Control the Media Progress
trans-unit.target: Add a Slider Bar to Control the Media Progress

trans-unit.source: Select Smooth Streaming Streams
trans-unit.target: Select Smooth Streaming Streams

trans-unit.source: Select Smooth Streaming Tracks
trans-unit.target: Select Smooth Streaming Tracks

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 32-bit or 64-bit.
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 32-bit or 64-bit.

trans-unit.source: You can get [Windows 8 Enterprise Evaluation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/evalcenter/jj554510.aspx) from MSDN.
trans-unit.target: You can get [Windows 8 Enterprise Evaluation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/evalcenter/jj554510.aspx) from MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows 8 installed on Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows 8 installed on Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: You can get the trial version from [here](http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/11/downloads).
trans-unit.target: You can get the trial version from [here](http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/11/downloads).

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8](http://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/04423d13-3b3e-4741-a01c-1ae29e84fea6?SRC=Homehttp://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/04423d13-3b3e-4741-a01c-1ae29e84fea6?SRC=Home).
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8](http://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/04423d13-3b3e-4741-a01c-1ae29e84fea6?SRC=Homehttp://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/04423d13-3b3e-4741-a01c-1ae29e84fea6?SRC=Home).

trans-unit.source: The completed solution for each lesson can be downloaded from MSDN Developer Code Samples (Code Gallery): [Lesson 1](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Smooth-Streaming-Client-0bb1471f "A Simple Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player"), [Lesson 2](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-simple-Windows-8-Smooth-ee98f63a "A Simple Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with a Slider Bar Control"), [Lesson 3](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-Windows-8-Smooth-883c3b44 "A Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with Stream Selection"), and [Lesson 4](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-Windows-8-Smooth-aa9e4907 "A Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with Track Selection").
trans-unit.target: The completed solution for each lesson can be downloaded from MSDN Developer Code Samples (Code Gallery): [Lesson 1](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Smooth-Streaming-Client-0bb1471f "A Simple Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player"), [Lesson 2](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-simple-Windows-8-Smooth-ee98f63a "A Simple Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with a Slider Bar Control"), [Lesson 3](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-Windows-8-Smooth-883c3b44 "A Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with Stream Selection"), and [Lesson 4](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/A-Windows-8-Smooth-aa9e4907 "A Windows 8 Smooth Streaming Media Player with Track Selection").

trans-unit.source: Lesson 1: Create a Basic Smooth Streaming Store Application
trans-unit.target: Lesson 1: Create a Basic Smooth Streaming Store Application

trans-unit.source: In this lesson, you will create a Windows Store application with a MediaElement control to play Smooth Stream content.
trans-unit.target: In this lesson, you will create a Windows Store application with a MediaElement control to play Smooth Stream content.

trans-unit.source: The running application looks like:
trans-unit.target: The running application looks like:

trans-unit.source: Smooth Streaming Windows Store application example
trans-unit.target: Smooth Streaming Windows Store application example

trans-unit.source: For more information on developing Windows Store application, see [Develop Great Apps for Windows 8](http://msdn.microsoft.com/windows/apps/br229512.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on developing Windows Store application, see [Develop Great Apps for Windows 8](http://msdn.microsoft.com/windows/apps/br229512.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This lesson contains the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: This lesson contains the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: Create a Windows Store project
trans-unit.target: Create a Windows Store project

trans-unit.source: Design the user interface (XAML)
trans-unit.target: Design the user interface (XAML)

trans-unit.source: Modify the code behind file
trans-unit.target: Modify the code behind file

trans-unit.source: Compile and test the application
trans-unit.target: Compile and test the application

trans-unit.source: To create a Windows Store project
trans-unit.target: To create a Windows Store project

trans-unit.source: Run Visual Studio 2012 or later.
trans-unit.target: Run Visual Studio 2012 or later.

trans-unit.source: From the **FILE** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **FILE** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: From the New Project dialog, type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: From the New Project dialog, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Template group
trans-unit.target: Template group

trans-unit.source: Installed/Templates/Visual C#/Windows Store
trans-unit.target: Installed/Templates/Visual C#/Windows Store

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Blank App (XAML)
trans-unit.target: Blank App (XAML)

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: SSPlayer
trans-unit.target: SSPlayer

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: C:\SSTutorials
trans-unit.target: C:\SSTutorials

trans-unit.source: Solution Name
trans-unit.target: Solution Name

trans-unit.source: SSPlayer
trans-unit.target: SSPlayer

trans-unit.source: Create directory for solution
trans-unit.target: Create directory for solution

trans-unit.source: (selected)
trans-unit.target: (selected)

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: To add a reference to the Smooth Streaming Client SDK
trans-unit.target: To add a reference to the Smooth Streaming Client SDK

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, right-click **SSPlayer**, and then click **Add Reference**.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, right-click **SSPlayer**, and then click **Add Reference**.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Reference group
trans-unit.target: Reference group

trans-unit.source: Windows/Extensions
trans-unit.target: Windows/Extensions

trans-unit.source: Reference
trans-unit.target: Reference

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8 and Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Package
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft Smooth Streaming Client SDK for Windows 8 and Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Package

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: After adding the references, you must select the targeted platform (x64 or x86), adding references will not work for Any CPU platform configuration.
trans-unit.target: After adding the references, you must select the targeted platform (x64 or x86), adding references will not work for Any CPU platform configuration.

trans-unit.source: In solution explorer, you will see yellow warning mark for these added references.
trans-unit.target: In solution explorer, you will see yellow warning mark for these added references.

trans-unit.source: To design the player user interface
trans-unit.target: To design the player user interface

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double click **MainPage.xaml** to open it in the design view.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double click **MainPage.xaml** to open it in the design view.

trans-unit.source: Locate the **<Grid>** and **</Grid>** tags the XAML file, and paste the following code between the two tags:
trans-unit.target: Locate the **<Grid>** and **</Grid>** tags the XAML file, and paste the following code between the two tags:

trans-unit.source: The MediaElement control is used to playback media.
trans-unit.target: The MediaElement control is used to playback media.

trans-unit.source: The slider control named sliderProgress will be used in the next lesson to control the media progress.
trans-unit.target: The slider control named sliderProgress will be used in the next lesson to control the media progress.

trans-unit.source: Press **CTRL+S** to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Press **CTRL+S** to save the file.

trans-unit.source: The MediaElement control does not support Smooth Streaming content out-of-box.
trans-unit.target: The MediaElement control does not support Smooth Streaming content out-of-box.

trans-unit.source: To enable the Smooth Streaming support, you must register the Smooth Streaming byte-stream handler by file name extension and MIME type.
trans-unit.target: To enable the Smooth Streaming support, you must register the Smooth Streaming byte-stream handler by file name extension and MIME type.

trans-unit.source: To register, you use the MediaExtensionManager.RegisterByteStremHandler method of the Windows.Media namespace.
trans-unit.target: To register, you use the MediaExtensionManager.RegisterByteStremHandler method of the Windows.Media namespace.

trans-unit.source: In this XAML file, some event handlers are associated with the controls.
trans-unit.target: In this XAML file, some event handlers are associated with the controls.

trans-unit.source: You must define those event handlers.
trans-unit.target: You must define those event handlers.

trans-unit.source: To modify the code behind file
trans-unit.target: To modify the code behind file

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, right-click **MainPage.xaml**, and then click **View Code**.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, right-click **MainPage.xaml**, and then click **View Code**.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the file, add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the file, add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of the **MainPage** class, add the following data member:
trans-unit.target: At the beginning of the **MainPage** class, add the following data member:

trans-unit.source: At the end of the **MainPage** constructor, add the following two lines:
trans-unit.target: At the end of the **MainPage** constructor, add the following two lines:

trans-unit.target: At the end of the **MainPage** class, past the following code:

trans-unit.source: The sliderProgress_PointerPressed event handler is defined here.
trans-unit.target: The sliderProgress_PointerPressed event handler is defined here.

trans-unit.source: There are more works to do to get it working, which will be covered in the next lesson of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: There are more works to do to get it working, which will be covered in the next lesson of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Press **CTRL+S** to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Press **CTRL+S** to save the file.

trans-unit.source: The finished the code behind file shall look like this:
trans-unit.target: The finished the code behind file shall look like this:

trans-unit.source: Codeview in Visual Studio of Smooth Streaming Windows Store application
trans-unit.target: Codeview in Visual Studio of Smooth Streaming Windows Store application

trans-unit.source: To compile and test the application
trans-unit.target: To compile and test the application

trans-unit.source: From the **BUILD** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.
trans-unit.target: From the **BUILD** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Change **Active solution platform** to match your development platform.
trans-unit.target: Change **Active solution platform** to match your development platform.

trans-unit.source: Press **F6** to compile the project.
trans-unit.target: Press **F6** to compile the project.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.

trans-unit.source: Click **Set Source**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set Source**.

trans-unit.source: Because **Auto Play** is enabled by default, the media shall play automatically.
trans-unit.target: Because **Auto Play** is enabled by default, the media shall play automatically.

trans-unit.source: You can control the media using the **Play**, **Pause** and **Stop** buttons.
trans-unit.target: You can control the media using the **Play**, **Pause** and **Stop** buttons.

trans-unit.source: You can control the media volume using the vertical slider.
trans-unit.target: You can control the media volume using the vertical slider.

trans-unit.source: However the horizontal slider for controlling the media progress is not fully implemented yet.
trans-unit.target: However the horizontal slider for controlling the media progress is not fully implemented yet.

trans-unit.source: You have completed lesson1.
trans-unit.target: You have completed lesson1.

trans-unit.source: In this lesson, you use a MediaElement control to playback Smooth Streaming content.
trans-unit.target: In this lesson, you use a MediaElement control to playback Smooth Streaming content.

trans-unit.source: In the next lesson, you will add a slider to control the progress of the Smooth Streaming content.
trans-unit.target: In the next lesson, you will add a slider to control the progress of the Smooth Streaming content.

trans-unit.source: Lesson 2: Add a Slider Bar to Control the Media Progress
trans-unit.target: Lesson 2: Add a Slider Bar to Control the Media Progress

trans-unit.source: In lesson 1, you created a Windows Store application with a MediaElement XAML control to playback Smooth Streaming media content.
trans-unit.target: In lesson 1, you created a Windows Store application with a MediaElement XAML control to playback Smooth Streaming media content.

trans-unit.source: It comes some basic media functions like start, stop and pause.
trans-unit.target: It comes some basic media functions like start, stop and pause.

trans-unit.source: In this lesson, you will add a slider bar control to the application.
trans-unit.target: In this lesson, you will add a slider bar control to the application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will use a timer to update the slider position based on the current position of the MediaElement control.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will use a timer to update the slider position based on the current position of the MediaElement control.

trans-unit.source: The slider start and end time also need to be updated in case of live content.
trans-unit.target: The slider start and end time also need to be updated in case of live content.

trans-unit.source: This can be better handled in the adaptive source update event.
trans-unit.target: This can be better handled in the adaptive source update event.

trans-unit.source: Media sources are objects that generate media data.
trans-unit.target: Media sources are objects that generate media data.

trans-unit.source: The source resolver takes a URL or byte stream and creates the appropriate media source for that content.
trans-unit.target: The source resolver takes a URL or byte stream and creates the appropriate media source for that content.

trans-unit.source: The source resolver is the standard way for the applications to create media sources.
trans-unit.target: The source resolver is the standard way for the applications to create media sources.

trans-unit.source: Lesson 3: Select Smooth Streaming Streams
trans-unit.target: Lesson 3: Select Smooth Streaming Streams

trans-unit.source: Smooth Streaming is capable to stream content with multiple language audio tracks that are selectable by the viewers.
trans-unit.target: Smooth Streaming is capable to stream content with multiple language audio tracks that are selectable by the viewers.

trans-unit.source: In this lesson, you will enable viewers to select streams.
trans-unit.target: In this lesson, you will enable viewers to select streams.

trans-unit.source: This lesson contains the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: To compile and test the application
trans-unit.target: To compile and test the application

trans-unit.source: Press **F6** to compile the project.
trans-unit.target: Press **F6** to compile the project.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.

trans-unit.source: Click **Set Source**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set Source**.

trans-unit.source: The default language is audio_eng.
trans-unit.target: The default language is audio_eng.

trans-unit.source: Try to switch between audio_eng and audio_es.
trans-unit.target: Try to switch between audio_eng and audio_es.

trans-unit.source: Everytime, you select a new stream, you must click the Submit button.
trans-unit.target: Everytime, you select a new stream, you must click the Submit button.

trans-unit.source: Lesson 4: Select Smooth Streaming Tracks
trans-unit.target: Lesson 4: Select Smooth Streaming Tracks

trans-unit.source: A Smooth Streaming presentation can contain multiple video files encoded with different quality levels (bit rates) and resolutions.
trans-unit.target: A Smooth Streaming presentation can contain multiple video files encoded with different quality levels (bit rates) and resolutions.

trans-unit.source: In this lesson, you will enable users to select tracks.
trans-unit.target: In this lesson, you will enable users to select tracks.

trans-unit.source: To compile and test the application
trans-unit.target: To compile and test the application

trans-unit.source: Press **F6** to compile the project.
trans-unit.target: Press **F6** to compile the project.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the application, you can either use the default Smooth Streaming URL or enter a different one.

trans-unit.source: Click **Set Source**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set Source**.

trans-unit.source: By default, all of the tracks of the video stream are selected.
trans-unit.target: By default, all of the tracks of the video stream are selected.

trans-unit.source: To experiment the bit rate changes, you can select the lowest bit rate available, and then select the highest bit rate available.
trans-unit.target: To experiment the bit rate changes, you can select the lowest bit rate available, and then select the highest bit rate available.

trans-unit.source: You must click Submit after each change.
trans-unit.target: You must click Submit after each change.

trans-unit.source: You can see the video quality changes.
trans-unit.target: You can see the video quality changes.

trans-unit.source: You have completed lesson 4.
trans-unit.target: You have completed lesson 4.
